snippet: As streaming grows in popularity, competing album sales metrics that yielded two different No. 1 albums illustrate the music industry at a crossroads.
abstract: Taylor Swift's album 1989 narrowly outsold Disney's Frozen soundtrack for number one album in 2014 based on traditional sales model of CDs and album downloads, but based on streaming services like Spotify and YouTube, their sales positions were reversed; CDs and download sales fell in 2014 for second year in row, while streaming rose 54.5 percent; music industry is at crossroads.
lead_paragraph: As streaming grows in popularity, competing album sales metrics that yielded two different No. 1 albums illustrate the music industry at a crossroads.

headline.main: How ‘1989’ Edged Out ‘Frozen’ as the No. 1 Album of 2014, and Vice Versa
headline.print_headline: Two No. 1 Albums in 2014? It Depends on the Charts
